title: Business & Finance
text:
Some Chinese state-run companies are restricting employees' use of Tencent's popular domestic messaging app, citing security concerns.

---

Individual investors, bucking inflation worries, continue to stampede into shares of growth companies that have enjoyed explosive price gains this year.

---

Stocks in Asia sank in early trading Friday and U.S. stock futures lost ground after South Africa raised the alarm over a new strain of the coronavirus.

---

Flights have been packed but relatively painless during the week of Thanksgiving, the first major test for airlines since they took steps to resolve traffic snarls.

---

AT&T and Verizon said they would limit some of their 5G wireless services for six months while U.S. regulators review the signals' effect on aircraft sensors.

---

Saudi Arabia and Russia are considering a move to pause their recent efforts to provide the world with more crude after the U.S. and other countries said they would tap oil reserves.

---

Chinese developer Kaisa warned it risked reneging on its international debts unless creditors agreed to a $400 million bond swap.
